member.name: IMFTranscodeProfile.GetAudioAttributes
member.summary: Gets the audio stream settings that are currently set in the transcode profile.
member.param: Receives a pointer to the interface of the attribute store containing the current audio stream settings. Caller must release the interface pointer.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IMFTranscodeProfile.GetContainerAttributes
member.summary: Gets the container settings that are currently set in the transcode profile.
member.param: Receives a pointer to the interface of the attribute store containing the current container type for the output file. Caller must release the interface pointer.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IMFTranscodeProfile.GetVideoAttributes
member.summary: Gets the video stream settings that are currently set in the transcode profile.
member.param: Receives a pointer to the interface of the attribute store containing the current video stream settings. Caller must release the interface pointer.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IMFTranscodeProfile.SetAudioAttributes

summary.para: Sets audio stream configuration settings in the transcode profile.

To get a list of compatible audio media types supported by the Media Foundation transform (MFT) encoder , call . You can get the attributes that are set on the required media type and set them on the transcode profile. To set the audio attributes properly, create a new attribute store and copy the attribute store from the required media media type by calling . This makes sure that the caller does not hold the references to the media type retrieved from the encoder. For example code, see .

member.param:
Pointer to the interface of an attribute store that contains the configuration settings for the audio stream. The specified attribute values overwrite any existing values stored in the transcode profile.
The following audio attributes can be set:
Audio Media Types
MF_TRANSCODE_DONOT_INSERT_ENCODER
MF_TRANSCODE_ENCODINGPROFILE
MF_TRANSCODE_QUALITYVSSPEED
To create the attribute store, call . To set a specific attribute value in the attribute store, the caller must call the appropriate methods depending on the data type of the attribute.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IMFTranscodeProfile.SetContainerAttributes

summary.para: Sets container configuration settings in the transcode profile.

member.param:
Pointer to the interface of an attribute store that contains the configuration settings for the container in which the transcoded file will be stored. The specified attribute values overwrite any existing values stored in the transcode profile.
The following list shows the container attributes that can be set:
MF_TRANSCODE_ADJUST_PROFILE
MF_TRANSCODE_CONTAINERTYPE
MF_TRANSCODE_SKIP_METADATA_TRANSFER
MF_TRANSCODE_TOPOLOGYMODE
MFT_FIELDOFUSE_UNLOCK
To create the attribute store, call . To set a specific attribute value in the attribute store, the caller must call the appropriate methods depending on the data type of the attribute.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IMFTranscodeProfile.SetVideoAttributes

summary.para: Sets video stream configuration settings in the transcode profile.

member.param:
Pointer to the interface of an attribute store that contains the configuration settings for the video stream. The specified attribute values overwrites any existing values stored in the transcode profile.
The following video attributes can be set:
Video Media Types
MF_TRANSCODE_DONOT_INSERT_ENCODER
MF_TRANSCODE_ENCODINGPROFILE
MF_TRANSCODE_QUALITYVSSPEED
To create the attribute store, call . To set a specific attribute value in the attribute store, the caller must call the appropriate methods depending on the data type of the attribute.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Implemented by the transcode profile object.

The transcode profile stores configuration settings that the topology builder uses to generate the transcode topology for the output file. These configuration settings are specified by the caller and include audio and video stream properties, encoder settings, and container settings that are specified by the caller.
To create the transcode profile object, call . The configured transcode profile is passed to , which creates the transcode topology with the appropriate settings.
